channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report E-2023100326
item.description:
Report E-2023100326

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN3266 Enrich No. 299 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct containment and cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-ounces of product released to the drum lid due to the drum being dropped, causing a puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All impacted rags used to clean the release were placed into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023090930
item.description:
Report X-2023090930

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-17
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP AND LEAKED OUT SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023090923
item.description:
Report X-2023090923

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-16
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was placed upside down in trailer forcing liquid through the lid. Package was discovered in the unload and was placed in a plastic lined tote. DescribePack: Liquid leaked through the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in a plastic lined tote and placed in the hazmat cage for processing.
